intro: Veratrum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white or pale green flowers. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, wooded habitats and is often found in swampy areas. Its botanical features include broad, lance-shaped leaves and a fibrous root system.
